name: imageDrawQuadraticCurve
syntax: imageDrawQuadraticCurve(name, ctrlx1, ctrly1, x1, y1, x2, y2)
member: someImage.drawQuadraticCurve(ctrlx1, ctrly1, x1, y1, x2, y2)
description: Draws a curved line. The curve is controlled by a single point.

params.name: name
params.description: The image on which this operation is performed.

params.name: x1
params.description: The x coordinate of the start point of the quadratic curve segment.

params.name: y1
params.description: The y coordinate of the start point of the quadratic curve segment.

params.name: ctrlx1
params.description: The x coordinate of the first control point of the quadratic curve segment.

params.name: ctrly1
params.description: The y coordinate of the first control point of the quadratic curve segment.

params.name: x2
params.description: The x coordinate of the end point of the quadratic curve segment.

params.name: y2
params.description: The y coordinate of the end point of the quadratic curve segment.

examples.title: Tag Syntax
examples.description: This example shows how to draw a curved line.OK
examples.code:
<!--- Use the imageNew function to create a 400x400-pixel image. ---> 
 <cfset myImage=imageNew("",400,400)> 
 <!--- Turn on antialiasing to improve image quality. ---> 
 <cfset imageSetAntialiasing(myImage,"on")> 
 <!--- Set the drawing color to green. ---> 
 <cfset imageSetDrawingColor(myImage,"green")> 
 <!--- Draw a curved line on the image. ---> 
 <cfset imageDrawQuadraticCurve(myImage,120,320,5,15,380,280)> 
 <!--- Display the image in a browser. ---> 
 <cfimage source="#myImage#" action="writeToBrowser">

examples.title: Using drawQuadraticCurve member function
examples.description: CF11+ Lucee4.5+ Create a new image. With the new image draw a cubic curve, starting at top left (0,0) ending at bottom right (152,152) with 1 control point at the bottom left (0,152)
